00033 // Includes
00034 #include <stdlib.h>
00035 #include "mac.h"
00036 #include "mac_event.h"
00037 #include "mac_data.h"
00038 #include "mac_scan.h"
00039 #include "mac_associate.h"
00040 #include "radio.h"
00041 #include "stdio.h"
00042 #include "timer.h"
00043 #include "system.h"
00044 
00057 // Globals
00058 
00060 #define MAX_EVENTS 10
00061 
00063 typedef struct {
00064     volatile u8 head;   
00065     volatile u8 tail;   
00066     event_object_t event_object[MAX_EVENTS]; 
00067 } event_queue_t;
00068 event_queue_t event_queue; 
00069 
00070 // Implementation
00071 
00077 u8 mac_event_pending(void)
00078 {
00079     return (event_queue.head != event_queue.tail);
00080 }
00081 
00082 
00088 void mac_put_event(event_object_t *object)
00089 {
00090     u8 newhead;
00091 
00092     if ((event_queue.head + 1) % MAX_EVENTS == event_queue.tail)
00093         // queue full, get outta here
00094         return;
00095 
00096     newhead = event_queue.head;
00097 
00098     // store in queue
00099     event_queue.event_object[newhead] = *object;
00100 
00101     // calculate new head index
00102     newhead++;
00103     if (newhead >= MAX_EVENTS)
00104         newhead = 0;
00105     event_queue.head = newhead;
00106 }
00107 
00116 event_object_t * mac_get_event(void)
00117 {
00118     event_object_t *object = NULL;
00119     volatile u8 newtail;
00120 
00121     newtail = event_queue.tail;
00122 
00123     object = &(event_queue.event_object[newtail]);
00124 
00125     // calculate new tail
00126     newtail++;
00127     if (newtail >= MAX_EVENTS)
00128         newtail = 0;
00129 
00130     event_queue.tail = newtail;
00131 
00132     return(object);
00133 }
00134 
00141 void macTask(void)
00142 {
00143     event_object_t *event;
00144 
00145     event = 0;
00146     while(mac_event_pending())
00147     {
00148         event = mac_get_event();
00149         switch (event->event)
00150         {
00151         case MAC_EVENT_SCAN:
00152             // A beacon has been received as a result of an active scan.
00153             // Record the pan descriptor and store it until the scan has
00154             // completed.
00155             if (!macConfig.associated)
00156                 mac_logPanDescriptors();
00157             break;
00158 #if __AVR__
00159        case MAC_EVENT_TIMER:
00160            // Timer has expired, just callback the stored function pointer
00161            ((void (*)(void))event->data)();  // cast data to function pointer
00162            break;
00163 #endif
00164         case MAC_EVENT_RX:
00165             if (macConfig.associated)
00166             {
00167                 // Wake up
00168                 if (NODETYPE != ENDDEVICE)
00169                     macChildIsAwake((ftData*)(mac_buffer_rx+1));
00170                 // Received a data frame, process it or route it
00171                 if (((ftData*)(mac_buffer_rx+1))->finalDestAddr == macConfig.shortAddress)
00172                     // This data frame is for this node
00173                     macDataIndication();
00174                 else
00175                     // Route the packet up/down stream
00176                     if (NODETYPE != ENDDEVICE)
00177                         macRouteData();
00178             }
00179             break;
00180         case MAC_EVENT_BEACON_REQ:
00181             // Generate and send the beacon.
00182             if (NODETYPE == ROUTER && macConfig.associated)
00183                 macSetAlarm(1, sendBeaconFrame);
00184             if (NODETYPE == COORD)
00185                 sendBeaconFrame();
00186             break;
00187         case MAC_EVENT_ASSOCIATION_REQUEST:
00188             // Pan Coord has received this request.
00189             if (NODETYPE == COORD)
00190                 macAssociationResponse();
00191             if (NODETYPE == ROUTER && macConfig.associated)
00192             {
00193                 // Send this packet along to parent
00194                 macRouteAssociateRequest();
00195             }
00196             break;
00197         case MAC_EVENT_ASSOCIATION_RESPONSE:
00198             // End device has recieved this response.
00199             if (NODETYPE != COORD)
00200             {
00201                 if (*((u16*)(mac_buffer_rx+1)) == FCF_ASSOC_RESP_DIRECT) // Direct to MAC Addr?
00202                 {
00203                     // this is a new node, do the association thing
00204                     macConfig.associated = true;
00205                     macConfig.parentShortAddress = ((ftAssocRespDirect*)(mac_buffer_rx+1))->srcAddr;
00206                     macConfig.shortAddress = ((ftAssocRespDirect*)(mac_buffer_rx+1))->shortAddr;
00207                     radioSetShortAddress(macConfig.shortAddress);
00208                     macAssociationConfirm();
00209                 }
00210                 else
00211                 {
00212                     // we are indirect, so just send this packet along.
00213                     if (NODETYPE == ROUTER && macConfig.associated)
00214                         macRouteAssociateResponse();
00215                 }
00216             }
00217             break;
00218         case MAC_EVENT_ROUTE:
00219             // Routing packet received, forward it
00220             if (NODETYPE == ROUTER && macConfig.associated)
00221                 macForwardRoutingPacket();
00222             break;
00223         case MAC_EVENT_ACCESS:
00224             // Channel access failure
00225             appPacketSendAccessFail();
00226             break;
00227         case MAC_EVENT_NACK:
00228             // Packet failed to be sent, alert application
00229             appPacketSendFailed();
00230             break;
00231         case MAC_EVENT_ACK:
00232             // Packet got through, alert application
00233             appPacketSendSucceed();
00234             break;
00235         default:
00236             break;
00237         }
00238     }
00239 }
